column4: hello all.... Question. If i installed ubuntu and wish I had installed kubuntu... do i need to start over? or can i fix this by uninstalling gnome and installing KDE?
you can uninstall gnome and install kde
installing kde and keeping gnome is easier though
install kubuntu-desktop
and that will acomplish the same thing as if i had used kubuntu?
yes
for even closer to the same thing, also install kdm
why keep gnome?
but it;s difficult to remove
/because it's difficult/
ok, how much space am i using with it?
probably not more than 300 MB
But if you do reinstsll and use kubuntu from scratch, DON'T FORGET TO BACKUP
is just installed ubuntu last night
good
as long as it leaves my other partitions alone, ill be fine
If you change distros often, you may want to have a data partition
um-
I missed the above
I had a laptop with xp on it and one big partition. i resized it last night and made a 10GB for ubuntu and a 25 fat32 for data. the Xp still works fine.
I keep 2 partitions for os's and one for data so I can (re)install whenever I like
